item.title: Migrate to flutter null safety safely
item.description: Null safety is the solution to the billion doller mistake and it’s available for Flutter as well, why live with billion doller mistake anymore! As null safety is available with Flutter 2.0 It comes with pretty handy migration guide and can simply use the tool to migrate to null safety nicely. But in reality it’s not that straight forward as it sounds for a medium to big projects, also there might be lots of third party dependencies and tool may produce lots of compile error (atleast it happened with me).

item.title: Must have tools for a Flutter dev
item.description: I’m enlisting the most usefull and popular tools for development with Flutter. undoubtedly , these will boost your productivity by a 110% ! Codemagic CI/CD Codemagic CI/CD is an excellent service for CI/CD especially made for Flutter. And free tier is more than enough for small to medium level. Dartpad Dartpad is an online editor for dart and Flutter, it’s really use to try out simple snippets or share snippets with others by any means.

item.title: Why are we embracing Flutter in our team?
item.description: The Simple answer is to make our life easier, for details keep reading! I work at a start-up. And like any other start-up, it has that typical start-up workload and crazy requirements that we need to meet along with Faster Delivery . Lack of resources. Frequent feature request. Experimental features. And off-course, technical debt. we have two codebases for two platforms (Android, iOS) written in Objective-C, Java and partially(new features) Kotlin and Swift.

item.description: After the first release Flutter is being too obvious to avoid it, lots of people are talking about flutter, and the technology behind it is interesting enough to check out.
